channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lamp post leaning., 29th July
item.description:
Lamp post was hit by a vehicle todey, located outside number 8 Kedleston Drive.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Kedleston Drive, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping in Burwash Rd from 34 Durham Rise, 29th July
item.description:
A Flytipped bead frame left by the garage door of 34 Durham Rise on Burwash Road. Asked the resident if it was theirs and he said yes. He didn’t think he should move it. Fed up with constant Flytipping here by the residents of Durham rise. Second photo show the state outside their house. Needs something to be done to stop it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burwash Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street overgrown with weeds, 29th July
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish on Truman’s Road, 29th July
item.description:
Recently there’s been an overflow of rubbish strewn across Truman’s Road which is not getting cleared by the bin men. This is a daily occurrence and is horrible to walk past. It also attracts animals such as foxes. This needs to be addressed.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salcombe Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3x carts left outside Pret, 29th July
item.description:
77/78 St Martin's Lane 3x carts left outside Pret on Long Acre are facing out onto the footway. Obstruction for vision impaired pedestrians. Handles overhang footway and are a danger for vision impaired pedestrians to walk into. This issue can be solved by removing the carts, or by turning the carts 90 degrees so that they no longer encroach upon, obstruct, and overhang the footway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cranbourn Street, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Food waste spillage by council refuse collection, 29th July
item.description:
Food waste spillage by council refuse collection when collection. Lots of flies and degraded liquid. Would you please confirm the are complying to section 34(7) of the Environmental Protection Act 1990. Can this be cleaned as soon as possible as there are young children live in neighbouring houses.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Forge Way, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet
